diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Angiosarcoma of the chest wall associated with a silicone breast implant, with metastasis to the lung, diffuse pulmonary hemorrhage, and thrombocytopenia (Kasabach-Merritt syndrome).
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient had progressive dyspnea and pulmonary infiltrates; CT scans showed a mass in the chest wall associated with the breast implant. The presence of a soft-tissue mass and pulmonary nodules raised suspicion of angiosarcoma, especially considering the patient's history of breast implant-related pain and immunosuppression. Additionally, bronchoalveolar lavage indicated invasive pulmonary aspergillosis, supported by positive cultures and fungal antigen tests.
